Article.Abstract: By using a series of overlapping synthetic peptides that cover more than 95% of the amino acid sequence of nucleoprotein (NP) of influenza A/NT/60/68 virus, five Th cell epitopes in B10.S (H-2s), BALB/c (H-2d), CBA (H-2k), and B6 (H-2b) mice have been identified. The specificity of Th cell recognition of epitopes is largely dependent on the H-2 haplotype of the responding mouse strain. However, two out of the five Th epitopes defined could be recognized by mice of more than one haplotype, implying that the primary sequence of protein antigens could also influence the selection of dominant T cell epitopes by the immune system. Immunization of B10.S mice with peptide 260-283 generated strong Th cell response against type A influenza viruses. In the other three strains of mice tested, priming with helper peptides induced a stronger antipeptide than antiviral T cell response. However, the low responsiveness to virus in these mice could be partially overcome by immunization with a mixture of several helper peptides. The Th epitopes are defined by the ability of the peptides to stimulate class II MHC restricted CD4+ T cells to proliferate and to produce IL-2 in vitro. When compared with the known epitopes on NP recognised by class I restricted CD8+ cytotoxic T cells, it appears that Th and cytotoxic T cell epitopes are nonoverlapping. The AMPHI and Motifs methods were employed to analyze the sequence of NP and predict the potential dominant sites in the molecule. The predictions are compared with the experimental data obtained and the implications discussed.
Article.ArticleTitle: Identification and characterization of T helper epitopes in the nucleoprotein of influenza A virus.
Article.Affiliations: Department of Experimental Immunobiology, Wellcome Research Laboratories, Kent, UK.
Article.ArticleMeshHeadingsList: Amino Acid Sequence; Animals; Antigens, Viral(immunology); Epitopes; Genes, MHC Class II; Influenza A virus(immunology); Lymphocyte Activation; Mice; Mice, Inbred Strains; Molecular Sequence Data; Nucleocapsid Proteins; Nucleoproteins(immunology); Oligopeptides(chemical synthesis; immunology); Structure-Activity Relationship; T-Lymphocytes, Cytotoxic(immunology); T-Lymphocytes, Helper-Inducer(immunology); Viral Core Proteins(immunology)

Epitope.EpitopeComments: This peptide is shown to be unable to induce significant proliferation in neither CBA/T6T6, BALB/c, C6 nor B10.S mice. No database entry for this strain nucleoprotein, but it is conserved in the NT/60/68 strain nucleoprotein for which the Swiss-Prot ID is provided.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 5 or 25 micrograms of virus.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed in the base of the tail with 5 micrograms or virus with 50 micrograms saponin as adjuvant. B6, BALB/c and CBA/T6T6 mice were immunized with 25 micrograms of virus.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lymph node cells from CBA/T6T6, BALB/c, C6, and B10.S source species-immunized mice do not proliferate significantly in response to stimulation with this peptide.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: This peptide is shown to be unable to induce significant proliferation in neither CBA/T6T6, BALB/c, C6 nor B10.S mice. No database entry for this strain nucleoprotein, but it is conserved in the NT/60/68 strain nucleoprotein for which the Swiss-Prot ID is provided.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 5 or 25 micrograms of virus.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed in the base of the tail with 5 micrograms of virus with 50 micrograms saponin as adjuvant. B6, BALB/c and CBA/T6T6 mice were immunized with 25 micrograms of virus.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lymph node cells from CBA/T6T6, BALB/c, C6, and B10.S source species-immunized mice do not proliferate significantly in response to stimulation with this peptide.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: This peptide is shown to be unable to induce significant proliferation in neither CBA/T6T6, BALB/c, C6 nor B10.S mice but is able to induce peptide pulsed target cell lysis from BALB/c T cells. No database entry for this strain nucleoprotein, but it is conserved in the NT/60/68 strain nucleoprotein for which the Swiss-Prot ID is provided.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 20 HAU/mouse

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Splenocytes were collected at least 3 wk after immunization. Splenocytes were restimulated for 5 days with splenocytes infected with source species (PR8 strain).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Splenic T cells from BALBc mice immunized with source species lysed peptide pulsed tumor cells.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 20 HAU/mouse

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Splenocytes were collected at least 3 wk after immunization. Splenocytes were restimulated for 5 days with splenocytes infected with source species (PR8 strain).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Splenic T cells from B6 mice immunized with source species are able to lyse peptide pulsed tumor cells.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 5 or 25 micrograms of virus.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed in the base of the tail with 5 micrograms of virus with 50 micrograms saponin as adjuvant. B6, BALB/c and CBA/T6T6 mice were immunized with 25 micrograms of virus.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lymph node cells from CBA/T6T6, BALB/c, C6, and B10.S source species-immunized mice do not proliferate significantly in response to stimulation with this peptide.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: This peptide is shown to be unable to induce significant proliferation in CBA/T6T6, BALB/c, C6 nor B10.S mice. No database entry for this strain nucleoprotein, but it is conserved in the NT/60/68 strain nucleoprotein for which the Swiss-Prot ID is provided.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 5 or 25 micrograms of virus.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed in the base of the tail with 5 micrograms of virus with 50 micrograms saponin as adjuvant. B6, BALB/c and CBA/T6T6 mice were immunized with 25 micrograms of virus.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lymph node cells from CBA/T6T6, BALB/c, C6, and B10.S source species-immunized mice do not proliferate significantly in response to stimulation with this peptide.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: This peptide is deduced to be the minimal epitope in region 55-77, inducing significant proliferation in BALB/c mice, but not in CBA/T6T6, B6 nor B10.S mice. This proliferation is shown to be CD4 and MHC II restricted. There is an overlapping epitope for CBA mice cytotoxic T cells in the region 50-64. No database entry for this strain nucleoprotein, but it is conserved in the NT/60/68 strain nucleoprotein for which the Swiss-Prot ID is provided.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 100 micrograms of peptide

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed in the base of the tail with 100 micrograms of peptide emulsified in CFA.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lymph node cells from BALB/c mice immunized with peptide containing this epitope proliferate poorly in response to source species, but a synergic proliferative response is achieved when immunization is performed with other immunogenic peptides with a strong anti-source protein response also seen.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 20 HAU/mouse

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Splenocytes were collected at least 3 wk after immunization. Splenocytes were restimulated for 5 days with splenocytes infected with source species (PR8 strain).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Splenic T cells from BALB/c mice immunized with source species are unable to lyse peptide pulsed tumor cells.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 25 micrograms of virus

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed in the base of the tail with 25 micrograms of virus with 50 micrograms saponin as adjuvant.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Source species-immunized BALB/c mice lymph node cells proliferate in response to peptides containing this epitope. Lymph node cells were obtained 7 days after immunization and incubated with different overlapping peptides spanning region 50-77 for 4 days.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 100 micrograms of peptide

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed in the base of the tail with 100 micrograms of peptide emulsified in CFA.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lymph node cells from BALB/c mice immunized with peptide containing this epitope proliferate in response to peptide.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: No database entry for this strain nucleoprotein, but it is conserved in the NT/60/68 strain nucleoprotein for which the Swiss-Prot ID is provided.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 5 micrograms of virus.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed in the base of the tail with 5 micrograms of virus with 50 micrograms saponin as adjuvant. B6 and CBA/T6T6 mice were immunized with 25 micrograms of virus.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lymph node cells obtained 7 days after immunization were incubated with peptide for 4 days. B6 and CBA/T6T6 mice produced similar results.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: This peptide is deduced to be the minimal epitope in region 182-205, inducing significant proliferation in BALB/c and CBA/T6T6 mice, but not in B6 nor B10.S mice. This proliferation is shown to be CD4 and MHC II restricted. No database entry for this strain nucleoprotein, but it is conserved in the NT/60/68 strain nucleoprotein for which the Swiss-Prot ID is provided.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 20 HAU/mouse

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Splenocytes were collected at least 3 wk after immunization. Splenocytes were restimulated for 5 days with splenocytes infected with source species (PR8 strain).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Splenic T cells from BALB/c or CBA mice immunized with source species are unable to lyse peptide pulsed tumor cells. With CBA mice, L929 cells were used as target cells.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 100 micrograms of peptide

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed in the base of the tail with 100 micrograms of peptide emulsified in CFA.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lymph node cells from CBA mice immunized with peptide containing this epitope proliferate in response to peptide. Similar results, but with lower levels of proliferation, are seen in BALB/c mice.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 100 micrograms of peptide

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed in the base of the tail with 100 micrograms of peptide emulsified in CFA.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lymph node cells from CBA mice immunized with peptide containing this epitope proliferate poorly in response to source species, but a synergic proliferative response is achieved when immunization is performed with another immunogenic peptide (280-283). In that case, a strong anti-source protein response is also seen. Similar results are seen in BALB/c mice when immunization is performed in combination with immunogenic peptides p206-229 and p55-77.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 25 micrograms of virus

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: CBA/T6T6 mice were also immunized. Immunization was performed in the base of the tail with 25 micrograms of virus with 50 micrograms saponin as adjuvant.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lymph node cells obtained 7 days after immunization were incubated with different overlapping peptides spanning region 182-205 for 4 days. The minimal epitope was deduced by proliferation of lymph node cells from source species-immunized BALB/c and CBA/T6T6 mice in response to overlapping peptides from the region containing this epitope.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: No database entry for this strain nucleoprotein, but it is conserved in the NT/60/68 strain nucleoprotein for which the Swiss-Prot ID is provided.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 5 or 25 micrograms of virus.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed in the base of the tail with 5 micrograms of virus for B10.S and 25 micrograms for B6 mice, with 50 micrograms saponin as adjuvant.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: B10.S mice gave similar results.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: This peptide is deduced to be the minimal epitope in region 206-229, inducing significant proliferation in BALB/c mice, but not in CBA/T6T6, B6 nor B10.S mice. This proliferation is shown to be CD4 and MHC II restricted. No database entry for this strain nucleoprotein, but it is conserved in the NT/60/68 strain nucleoprotein for which the Swiss-Prot ID is provided.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 100 micrograms of peptide

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed in the base of the tail with 100 micrograms of peptide emulsified in CFA.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lymph node cells from BALB/c mice immunized with peptide containing this epitope proliferate in response to peptide.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 20 HAU/mouse

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Splenocytes were collected at least 3 wk after immunization. Splenocytes were restimulated for 5 days with splenocytes infected with source species (PR8 strain).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Splenic T cells from BALB/c mice immunized with source species are unable to lyse peptide pulsed tumor cells.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 100 micrograms of peptide

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed in the base of the tail with 100 micrograms of peptide emulsified in CFA.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lymph node cells from BALB/c mice immunized with peptide containing this epitope proliferate poorly in response to source species, but a synergic proliferative response is achieved when immunization is performed with other immunogenic peptides. In that case, a strong anti-source protein response is also seen.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 25 micrograms of virus

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed in the base of the tail with 25 micrograms of virus with 50 micrograms saponin as adjuvant.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lymph node cells obtained 7 days after immunization were incubated with different overlapping peptides spanning region 206-229. The Minimal epitope was deduced by proliferation of lymph node cells from source species-immunized BALB/c mice in response to overlapping peptides that contain this epitope.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: No database entry for this strain nucleoprotein, but it is conserved in the NT/60/68 strain nucleoprotein for which the Swiss-Prot ID is provided.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 5 micrograms of virus.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed in the base of the tail with 5 micrograms of virus with 50 micrograms saponin as adjuvant. B6 and CBA/T6T6 mice were immunized with 25 micrograms of virus.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: B6 and CBA/T6T6 mice gave similar results.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: This peptide induces significant proliferation in CBA/T6T6, B6 and B10.S mice, but not in BALB/c mice. This proliferation is shown to be CD4 and MHC II restricted. No database entry for this strain nucleoprotein, but it is conserved in the NT/60/68 strain nucleoprotein for which the Swiss-Prot ID is provided.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 100 micrograms of peptide

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed in the base of the tail with 100 micrograms of peptide emulsified in CFA.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lymph node cells from B10.S mice immunized with peptide proliferate in response to source species, in a MHC-II and CD4 restricted fashion.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 20 HAU/mouse

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Splenocytes were collected at least 3 wk after immunization. Splenocytes were restimulated for 5 days with splenocytes infected with source species (PR8 strain).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Splenic T cells from CBA or B6 mice immunized with source species are unable to lyse peptide pulsed tumor cells. With CBA mice, L929 were used as target cells, while EL4 target cells were used with B6 mice.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 100 micrograms of peptide

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed in the base of the tail with 100 micrograms of peptide emulsified in CFA.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lymph node cells from CBA mice immunized with peptide containing this epitope proliferate in response to peptide in vitro.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 25 micrograms of virus

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed in the base of the tail with 25 micrograms of virus with 50 micrograms saponin as adjuvant.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lymph node cells from source species-immunized BALB/c mice are unable to proliferate in response to this peptide.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 100 micrograms of peptide

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed in the base of the tail with 100 micrograms of peptide emulsified in CFA.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lymph node cells from CBA mice immunized with peptide containing this epitope proliferate poorly in response to source species, but a synergic proliferative response is achieved when immunization is performed with another immunogenic peptide (P182-205). In that case, a strong anti-source protein response is also seen.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 5 or 25 micrograms of virus

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed in the base of the tail with 5 (B10.S) or 25 (B6 and CBA) micrograms of virus with 50 micrograms saponin as adjuvant.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Similar results are seen with CBA and B6 mice. The response is inhibited by antibodies against CD4 and MHC II, but not against CD8. IL-2 release was also demonstrated.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: This peptide induces significant proliferation in B6 mice, but not in BALB/c, CBA/T6T6 or B10.S mice. This proliferation is said to be CD4 and MHC II restricted. No database entry for this strain nucleoprotein, but it is conserved in the NT/60/68 strain nucleoprotein for which the Swiss-Prot ID is provided.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 20 HAU/mouse

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Splenocytes were collected at least 3 wk after immunization. Splenocytes were restimulated for 5 days with splenocytes infected with source species (PR8 strain).

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Splenic T cells from B6 mice immunized with source species are unable to lyse peptide pulsed tumor cells.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 25 micrograms of virus

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed in the base of the tail with 25 micrograms of virus with 50 micrograms saponin as adjuvant.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lymph node cells from source species-immunized B6 mice proliferate in response to this peptide.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 1 dose of 5 or 25 micrograms of virus

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Immunization was performed in the base of the tail with 5 (B10.S) or 25 (BALB/c and CBA) micrograms of virus with 50 micrograms saponin as adjuvant.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lymph node cells from source species-immunized BALB/c, CBA/T6T6 and B10.S mice are unable to proliferate in response to this peptide.
